CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 27,1945, pg. 1, reads: "Carol Brice and Fritz Reiner shake hands at the completion of their concert Sunday afternoon, when the songbird did several numbers with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, of which Mr. Reiner is conductor. - Courier Photo by Harris."Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 1, 1945, pg. 19, reads: "On the Glory Road - Most recent laurel to be added to the spectacular career of Carol Brice was the assignment as soloist with the Columbia Concert Orchestra, broadcast nationally each Tuesday at 6:30 P. M. over the CBS Network. The young contralto recently conducted a coast to coast broadcast from St. Paul's Chapel with the CBS orchestra."
TitMainTitle: Contralto Carol Brice shaking hands with Pittsburgh Symphony conductor Fritz Reiner (with masking paint), in Syria Mosque with photograph on wall inscribed to James Barber from Paul
